item.title: Unit 2 Vocab
item.description: Unit 2 Vocab Unit2 Scale Factor Dilation Center of Dilation Similar Slope The slope of a line is a number we can calculate using any two points on the line. To find the slope, divide the vertical distance between the points by the horizontal distance. The slope of this line is 2 divided by 3 or 2/3. Simply put, the slope of a line is the ratio of rise to run of a line.
